1import os 

2import urllib.parse 

3import urllib.request 

4import urllib.error 

5import random 

6import astropy.wcs as ap_wcs 

7 

8import opihiexarata.library as library 

9import opihiexarata.library.error as error 

10import opihiexarata.library.hint as hint 

11 

12# The base URL for the API which all other service URLs are derived from. 

13_DEFAULT_BASE_ASTROMETRY_NET_NOVA_WEB_URL = "http://nova.astrometry.net/api/" 

14 

15 

16class AstrometryNetWebAPIEngine(library.engine.AstrometryEngine): 

17 """A python-based wrapper around the web API for astrometry.net. 

18 

19 This API does not have the full functionality of the default Python client 

20 seen at https://github.com/dstndstn/astrometry.net/blob/master/net/client/client.py. 

21 The point of this class is to be simple enough to be understood by others and 

22 be specialized for OpihiExarata. 

23 

24 Attributes 

25 ---------- 

26 _ASTROMETRY_NET_API_BASE_URL : string 

27 The base URL for the API which all other service URLs are derived from. 

28 _apikey : string 

29 The API key used to log in. 

30 original_upload_filename : string 

31 The original filename that was used to upload the data. 

32 session : string 

33 The session ID of this API connection to astrometry.net 

34 """ 

35 

36 def __init__(self, url=None, apikey: str = None, silent: bool = True) -> None: 

37 """The instantiation, connecting to the web API using the API key. 

38 

39 Parameters 

40 ---------- 

41 url : string, default = None 

42 The base url which all other API URL links are derived from. This 

43 should be used if the API is a self-hosted install or has a 

44 different web source than nova.astrometry.net. Defaults to the 

45 nova.astrometry.net api service. 

46 apikey : string 

47 The API key of the user. 

48 silent : bool, default = True 

49 Should there be printed messages as the processes are executed. 

50 This is helpful for debugging or similar processes. 

51 

52 Returns 

53 ------- 

54 None 

55 """ 

56 # Defining the URL. 

57 self._ASTROMETRY_NET_API_BASE_URL = ( 

58 str(url) if url is not None else _DEFAULT_BASE_ASTROMETRY_NET_NOVA_WEB_URL 

59 ) 

60 

61 # Base parameters. 

62 # The default arguments for uploading files. In (key, value, type) form. 

63 # Detailed is also their useage cases per 

64 # http://astrometry.net/doc/net/api.html#submitting-a-url 

65 self._DEFAULT_URL_ARGUMENTS = [ 

66 # These parameters are for licensing and distribution terms. 

67 ("allow_commercial_use", "d", str), 

68 ("allow_modifications", "d", str), 

69 # For visibility by the general public. 

70 ("publicly_visible", "y", str), 

71 # Image scaling parameters, if provided, when known, helps the 

72 # processing a little. 

73 ("scale_units", None, str), 

74 ("scale_type", None, str), 

75 ("scale_lower", None, float), 

76 ("scale_upper", None, float), 

77 ("scale_est", None, float), 

78 ("scale_err", None, float), 

79 # These parameters allows for the establishment of an initial guess 

80 # specified byt he centers, and its maximal deviation as specified 

81 # by the radius parameter. (In degrees.) 

82 ("center_ra", None, float), 

83 ("center_dec", None, float), 

84 ("radius", None, float), 

85 # Image properties, preprocessing it a little can help in its 

86 # determination. 

87 ("parity", None, int), 

88 ("downsample_factor", None, int), 

89 ("positional_error", None, float), 

90 ("tweak_order", None, int), 

91 ("crpix_center", None, bool), 

92 ("invert", None, bool), 

93 # These parameters are needed if being sent instead is an x,y list of 

94 # source star positions. 

95 ("image_width", None, int), 

96 ("image_height", None, int), 

97 ("x", None, list), 

98 ("y", None, list), 

99 ("album", None, str), 

100 ] 

101 

102 # Use the API key to log in a derive a session key. 

103 self.session = None 

104 session_key = self.__login(apikey=apikey) 

105 self._apikey = apikey 

106 self.session = session_key 

107 

108 # Placeholder variables. 

109 self.original_upload_filename = str() 

110 self._image_return_results = {} 

111 return None 

112 

113 def __login(self, apikey: str) -> str: 

114 """The method to log into the API system. 

115 

116 Parameters 

117 ---------- 

118 apikey : string 

119 The API key for the web API service. 

120 

121 Returns 

122 ------- 

123 session_key : string 

124 The session key for this login session. 

125 """ 

126 # The key. 

127 args = {"apikey": apikey} 

128 result = self._send_web_request(service="login", args=args) 

129 session = result.get("session", False) 

130 # Check if the session works and that the API key given is valid. 

131 if not session: 

132 raise error.WebRequestError( 

133 "The provided API key did not provide a valid session." 

134 ) 

135 else: 

136 # The session should be fine. 

137 session_key = session 

138 return session_key 

139 

140 def __get_submission_id(self) -> str: 

141 """Extract the submission ID from the image upload results.""" 

142 image_results = self._image_return_results 

143 self.__submission_id = image_results.get("subid", None) 

144 return self.__submission_id 

145 

146 def __set_submission_id(self, sub_id) -> None: 

147 """Assign the submission ID, it should only be done once when the 

148 image is obtained.""" 

149 if self.__submission_id is None: 

150 self.__submission_id = sub_id 

151 else: 

152 raise error.ReadOnlyError( 

153 "The submission ID has already been set by obtaining it from the API" 

154 " service." 

155 ) 

156 return None 

157 

158 def __del_submission_id(self) -> None: 

159 """Remove the current submission ID association.""" 

160 self.__submission_id = None 

161 return None 

162 

163 __doc_submission_id = ( 

164 "When file upload or table upload is sent to the API, the submission ID is" 

165 " saved here." 

166 ) 

167 __submission_id = None 

168 submission_id = property( 

169 __get_submission_id, 

170 __set_submission_id, 

171 __del_submission_id, 

172 __doc_submission_id, 

173 ) 

174 

175 def __get_job_id(self) -> str: 

176 """Extract the job ID from the image upload results. It may be the 

177 case that there is not job yet associated with this submission. 

178 """ 

179 # If the job ID already has been obtained, then there is no reason to 

180 # call the API again. 

181 if self.__job_id is not None: 

182 return self.__job_id 

183 # Call the API to get the job ID. 

184 try: 

185 submission_results = self.get_submission_results( 

186 submission_id=self.submission_id 

187 ) 

188 except error.WebRequestError: 

189 # Make a more helpful error message for what is going on. 

190 if self.submission_id is None: 

191 raise error.WebRequestError( 

192 "There cannot be a job id without there being a submission for that" 

193 " job to operate on." 

194 ) 

195 else: 

196 # What happened is unknown. 

197 raise error.UndiscoveredError("Why the web request failed is unknown.") 

198 else: 

199 job_id_list = submission_results.get("jobs", []) 

200 # If there are no jobs, then it is likely still in queue. 

201 if len(job_id_list) == 0: 

202 self.__job_id = None 

203 else: 

204 self.__job_id = job_id_list[-1] 

205 return self.__job_id 

206 raise error.LogicFlowError 

207 return None 

208 

209 def __set_job_id(self, job_id) -> None: 

210 """Assign the job ID, it should only be done once when the 

211 image is obtained.""" 

212 if self.__job_id is None: 

213 self.__job_id = job_id 

214 else: 

215 raise error.ReadOnlyError( 

216 "The job ID has already been set by obtaining it from the API service." 

217 ) 

218 return None 

219 

220 def __del_job_id(self) -> None: 

221 """Remove the current job ID association.""" 

222 self.__job_id = None 

223 return None 

224 

225 __doc_job_id = ( 

226 "When file upload or table upload is sent to the API, the job ID of the" 

227 " submission is saved here." 

228 ) 

229 __job_id = None 

230 job_id = property(__get_job_id, __set_job_id, __del_job_id, __doc_job_id) 

231 

232 def _generate_service_url(self, service: str) -> str: 

233 """Generate the correct URL for the desired service. Because astrometry.net 

234 uses a convention, we can follow it to obtain the desired service URL. 

235 

236 Parameters 

237 ---------- 

238 service : str 

239 The service which the API URL for should be generated from. 

240 

241 Returns 

242 ------- 

243 url : str 

244 The URL for the service. 

245 """ 

246 url = self._ASTROMETRY_NET_API_BASE_URL + service 

247 return url 

248 

249 def _generate_upload_args(self, **kwargs) -> dict: 

250 """Generate the arguments for sending a request. This constructs the 

251 needed arguments, replacing the defaults with user provided arguments 

252 where desired. 

253 

254 Parameters 

255 ---------- 

256 **kwargs : dict 

257 Arguments which would override the defaults. 

258 

259 Returns 

260 ------- 

261 args : dict 

262 The arguments which can be used to send the request. 

263 

264 """ 

265 args = {} 

266 for keydex, defaultdex, typedex in self._DEFAULT_URL_ARGUMENTS: 

267 if keydex in kwargs: 

268 new_value = kwargs.pop(keydex) 

269 new_value = typedex(new_value) 

270 args.update({keydex: new_value}) 

271 elif defaultdex is not None: 

272 args.update({keydex: defaultdex}) 

273 return args 

274 

275 def _send_web_request( 

276 self, service: str, args: dict = {}, file_args: dict = None 

277 ) -> dict: 

278 """A wrapper function for sending a webrequest to the astrometry.net API 

279 service. Returns the results as well. 

280 

281 Parameters 

282 ---------- 

283 service : string 

284 The service which is being requested. The web URL is constructed 

285 from this string. 

286 args : dictionary, default = {} 

287 The arguments being sent over the web request. 

288 file_args : dictionary, default = None 

289 If a file is being uploaded instead, special care must be taken to 

290 sure it matches the upload specifications. 

291 

292 Returns 

293 ------- 

294 results : dictionary 

295 The results of the web request if it did not fail. 

296 """ 

297 # Obtain the session key derived when this class is instantiated and 

298 # logged into. Use this session key for requests. 

299 if self.session is not None: 

300 args.update({"session": self.session}) 

301 # The API requires that the data format must be a JSON based datatype. 

302 json_data = library.json.dictionary_to_json(dictionary=args) 

303 # The URL which to send this request to, constructed from the service 

304 # desired. 

305 api_url = self._generate_service_url(service=service) 

306 

307 # If the request requires that a file be send, then it must be in the 

308 # correct format. Namely, a multipart/form-data format. 

309 if file_args is not None: 

310 boundary_key = "".join([random.choice("0123456789") for __ in range(19)]) 

311 boundary = "==============={bkey}==".format(bkey=boundary_key) 

312 headers = { 

313 "Content-Type": 'multipart/form-data; boundary="{bd}"'.format( 

314 bd=boundary 

315 ) 

316 } 

317 data_pre = str( 

318 "--" 

319 + boundary 

320 + "\n" 

321 + "Content-Type: text/plain\r\n" 

322 + "MIME-Version: 1.0\r\n" 

323 + 'Content-disposition: form-data; name="request-json"\r\n' 

324 + "\r\n" 

325 + json_data 

326 + "\n" 

327 + "--" 

328 + boundary 

329 + "\n" 

330 + "Content-Type: application/octet-stream\r\n" 

331 + "MIME-Version: 1.0\r\n" 

332 + 'Content-disposition: form-data; name="file"; filename="{name}"'.format( 

333 name=file_args["filename"] 

334 ) 

335 + "\r\n" 

336 + "\r\n" 

337 ) 

338 data_post = "\n" + "--" + boundary + "--\n" 

339 data = data_pre.encode() + file_args["data"] + data_post.encode() 

340 

341 else: 

342 # Otherwise, the form should be standard encoded: x-www-form-encoded 

343 headers = {} 

344 data = {"request-json": json_data} 

345 data = urllib.parse.urlencode(data) 

346 data = data.encode("utf-8") 

347 

348 # Finally send the request. 

349 request = urllib.request.Request(url=api_url, headers=headers, data=data) 

350 

351 # Processing the request. 

352 try: 

353 file = urllib.request.urlopen( 

354 request, timeout=library.config.ASTROMETRYNET_WEBAPI_JOB_QUEUE_TIMEOUT 

355 ) 

356 text = file.read() 

357 result = library.json.json_to_dictionary(json_string=text) 

358 # Check if the status of the request provided is a valid status. 

359 status = result.get("status") 

360 if status == "error": 

361 error_message = result.get("errormessage", "(none)") 

362 # Try to deduce what the error is. 

363 if error_message == "bad apikey": 

364 raise error.WebRequestError( 

365 "The API key provided is not a valid key." 

366 ) 

367 else: 

368 raise error.WebRequestError( 

369 "The server returned an error status message: \n {message}".format( 

370 message=error_message 

371 ) 

372 ) 

373 else: 

374 return result 

375 except urllib.error.HTTPError: 

376 raise error.WebRequestError( 

377 "The web request output cannot be properly processed. This is likely" 

378 " from a bad web request." 

379 ) 

380 # The logic should not flow beyond this point. 

381 raise error.LogicFlowError 

382 return None 

383 

384 def get_job_results(self, job_id: str = None) -> dict: 

385 """Get the results of a job sent to the API service. 

386 

387 Parameters 

388 ---------- 

389 job_id : str, default = None 

390 The ID of the job that the results should be obtained from. If not 

391 provided, the ID determined by the file upload is used. 

392 

393 Returns 

394 ------- 

395 results : dict 

396 The results of the astrometry.net job. They are, in general: (If 

397 the job has not finished yet, None is returned.) 

398 

399 - Status : The status of the job. 

400 - Calibration : Calibration of the image uploaded. 

401 - Tags : Known tagged objects in the image, people inputted. 

402 - Machine Tags : Ditto for tags, but only via machine inputs. 

403 - Objects in field : Known objects in the image field. 

404 - Annotations : Known objects in the field, with annotations. 

405 - Info : A collection of most everything above. 

406 """ 

407 job_id = job_id if job_id is not None else self.job_id 

408 # Get the result of the job. 

409 service_string = "jobs/{id}".format(id=job_id) 

410 try: 

411 job_result = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

412 except error.WebRequestError: 

413 # This error is likely because the job is still in queue. 

414 return None 

415 # Check that the service was successful. 

416 status = job_result.get("status", False) 

417 if status != "success": 

418 raise error.WebRequestError( 

419 "The job result request failed, check that the job ID is correct or try" 

420 " again later." 

421 ) 

422 else: 

423 results = {} 

424 # For the status. 

425 results["status"] = status 

426 # For the calibrations. 

427 service_string = "jobs/{id}/calibration".format(id=job_id) 

428 results["calibration"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

429 # For the tags. 

430 service_string = "jobs/{id}/tags".format(id=job_id) 

431 results["tags"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

432 # For the machine tags. 

433 service_string = "jobs/{id}/machine_tags".format(id=job_id) 

434 results["machine_tags"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

435 # For the objects in field. 

436 service_string = "jobs/{id}/objects_in_field".format(id=job_id) 

437 results["objects_in_field"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

438 # For the annotations. 

439 service_string = "jobs/{id}/annotations".format(id=job_id) 

440 results["annotations"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

441 # For the info. 

442 service_string = "jobs/{id}/info".format(id=job_id) 

443 results["info"] = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

444 # All done. 

445 return results 

446 

447 def get_job_status(self, job_id: str = None) -> str: 

448 """Get the status of a job specified by its ID. 

449 

450 Parameters 

451 ---------- 

452 job_id : str, default = None 

453 The ID of the job that the results should be obtained from. If not 

454 provided, the ID determined by the file upload is used. 

455 

456 Returns 

457 ------- 

458 status : string 

459 The status of the submission. If the job has not run yet, None is 

460 returned instead. 

461 """ 

462 job_id = job_id if job_id is not None else self.job_id 

463 # Get the result of the job. 

464 service_string = "jobs/{id}".format(id=job_id) 

465 status = None 

466 try: 

467 job_result = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

468 except error.WebRequestError: 

469 # This error is likely because the job is still in queue. 

470 status = None 

471 else: 

472 # Check the job status. 

473 status = job_result.get("status") 

474 finally: 

475 return status 

476 # Should not get here. 

477 raise error.LogicFlowError 

478 return None 

479 

480 def get_submission_results(self, submission_id: str = None) -> dict: 

481 """Get the results of a submission specified by its ID. 

482 

483 Parameters 

484 ---------- 

485 submission_id : str 

486 The ID of the submission. If it is not passed, the ID determined 

487 by the file upload is used. 

488 

489 Returns 

490 ------- 

491 result : dict 

492 The result of the submission. 

493 """ 

494 submission_id = ( 

495 submission_id if submission_id is not None else self.submission_id 

496 ) 

497 service_string = "submissions/{sub_id}".format(sub_id=submission_id) 

498 result = self._send_web_request(service=service_string) 

499 return result 

500 

501 def get_submission_status(self, submission_id: str = None) -> str: 

502 """Get the status of a submission specified by its ID. 

503 

504 Parameters 

505 ---------- 

506 submission_id : str, default = None 

507 The ID of the submission. If it is not passed, the ID determined 

508 by the file upload is used. 

509 

510 Returns 

511 ------- 

512 status : string 

513 The status of the submission. 

514 """ 

515 submission_id = ( 

516 submission_id if submission_id is not None else self.submission_id 

517 ) 

518 results = self.get_submission_results(submission_id=submission_id) 

519 status = results.get("status") 

520 return status

522 def get_reference_star_pixel_correlation( 

523 self, job_id: str = None, temp_filename: str = None, delete_after: bool = True 

524 ) -> hint.Table: 

525 """This obtains the table that correlates the location of reference 

526 stars and their pixel locations. It is obtained from the fits corr file 

527 that is downloaded into a temporary directory. 

528 

529 Parameters 

530 ---------- 

531 job_id : string, default = None 

532 The ID of the job that the results should be obtained from. If not 

533 provided, the ID determined by the file upload is used. 

534 temp_filename : string, default = None 

535 The filename that the downloaded correlation file will be 

536 downloaded as. The path is going to still be in the temporary 

537 directory. 

538 delete_after : bool, default = True 

539 Delete the file after downloading it to extract its information. 

540 

541 Returns 

542 ------- 

543 correlation_table : Table 

544 The table which details the correlation between the coordinates of 

545 the stars and their pixel locations. 

546 """ 

547 job_id = job_id if job_id is not None else self.job_id 

548 # Download the correlation file to read into a data table. 

549 upload_filename = library.path.get_filename_without_extension( 

550 pathname=self.original_upload_filename 

551 ) 

552 fits_table_filename = ( 

553 temp_filename if temp_filename is not None else upload_filename + "_corr" 

554 ) 

555 # The full path of the filename derived from saving it in a temporary 

556 # directory. 

557 corr_filename = library.path.merge_pathname( 

558 filename=fits_table_filename, extension="fits" 

559 ) 

560 corr_pathname = library.temporary.make_temporary_directory_path( 

561 filename=corr_filename 

562 ) 

563 # Save the correlation file. 

564 self.download_result_file( 

565 filename=corr_pathname, file_type="corr", job_id=job_id 

566 ) 

567 # Load the data from the file. 

568 __, correlation_table = library.fits.read_fits_table_file( 

569 filename=corr_pathname, extension=1 

570 ) 

571 # Delete the temporary file after loading it if desired. 

572 if delete_after: 

573 os.remove(corr_pathname) 

574 return correlation_table 

575 

576 def get_wcs( 

577 self, job_id: str = None, temp_filename: str = None, delete_after: bool = True 

578 ) -> hint.WCS: 

579 """This obtains the wcs header file and then computes World Coordinate 

580 System solution from it. Because astrometry.net computes it for us, 

581 we just extract it from the header file using Astropy. 

582 

583 Parameters 

584 ---------- 

585 job_id : string, default = None 

586 The ID of the job that the results should be obtained from. If not 

587 provided, the ID determined by the file upload is used. 

588 temp_filename : string, default = None 

589 The filename that the downloaded wcs file will be downloaded as. 

590 The path is going to still be in the temporary directory. 

591 delete_after : bool, default = True 

592 Delete the file after downloading it to extract its information. 

593 

594 Returns 

595 ------- 

596 wcs : Astropy WCS 

597 The world coordinate solution class for the image provided. 

598 """ 

599 job_id = job_id if job_id is not None else self.job_id 

600 # Download the correlation file to read into a data table. 

601 upload_filename = library.path.get_filename_without_extension( 

602 pathname=self.original_upload_filename 

603 ) 

604 fits_table_filename = ( 

605 temp_filename if temp_filename is not None else upload_filename + "_wcs" 

606 ) 

607 # The full path of the filename derived from saving it in a temporary 

608 # directory. 

609 corr_filename = library.path.merge_pathname( 

610 filename=fits_table_filename, extension="fits" 

611 ) 

612 corr_pathname = library.temporary.make_temporary_directory_path( 

613 filename=corr_filename 

614 ) 

615 # Save the correlation file. 

616 self.download_result_file( 

617 filename=corr_pathname, file_type="wcs", job_id=job_id 

618 ) 

619 # Load the header from the file. 

620 wcs_header = library.fits.read_fits_header(filename=corr_pathname) 

621 wcs = ap_wcs.WCS(wcs_header) 

622 

623 # Delete the temporary file after loading it if desired. 

624 if delete_after: 

625 os.remove(corr_pathname) 

626 return wcs 

627 

628 def upload_file(self, pathname: str, **kwargs) -> dict: 

629 """A wrapper to allow for the uploading of files or images to the API. 

630 

631 This also determines the submission ID and the job ID for the uploaded 

632 image and saves it. 

633 

634 Parameters 

635 ---------- 

636 pathname : str 

637 The pathname of the file to open. The filename is extracted and 

638 used as well. 

639 

640 Returns 

641 ------- 

642 results : dict 

643 The results of the API call to upload the image. 

644 """ 

645 # When uploading a new file, the submission and job IDs will change. 

646 # They must be reset because of their read-only nature. 

647 del self.submission_id, self.job_id 

648 

649 # Save the file information. 

650 self.original_upload_filename = pathname 

651 

652 args = self._generate_upload_args(**kwargs) 

653 # Process the file upload. 

654 file_args = None 

655 try: 

656 file = open(pathname, "rb") 

657 filename = library.path.get_filename_with_extension(pathname=pathname) 

658 file_args = {"filename": filename, "data": file.read()} 

659 except IOError: 

660 raise error.FileError("File does not exist: {path}".format(path=pathname)) 

661 # Extract the submission id. This allows for easier 

662 # association between this class instance and the uploaded file. 

663 upload_results = self._send_web_request("upload", args, file_args) 

664 self._image_return_results = upload_results 

665 return upload_results 

666 

667 def download_result_file( 

668 self, filename: str, file_type: str, job_id: str = None 

669 ) -> None: 

670 """Downloads fits data table files which correspond to the job id. 

671 

672 Parameters 

673 ---------- 

674 filename : str 

675 The filename of the file when it is downloaded and saved to disk. 

676 file_type : str 

677 The type of file to be downloaded from astrometry.net. It should 

678 one of the following: 

679 

680 - `wcs`: The world corrdinate data table file. 

681 - `new_fits`, `new_image`: A new fits file, containing the 

682 original image, annotations, and WCS header information. 

683 - `rdls`: A table of reference stars nearby. 

684 - `axy`: A table in of the location of stars detected in the 

685 provided image. 

686 - `corr`: A table of the correspondences between reference 

687 stars location in the sky and in pixel space. 

688 

689 job_id : str, default = None 

690 The ID of the job that the results should be obtained from. If not 

691 provided, the ID determined by the file upload is used. 

692 

693 Returns 

694 ------- 

695 None 

696 """ 

697 # Get the proper job ID. 

698 job_id = job_id if job_id is not None else self.job_id 

699 # Ensure that the type provided is a valid type which we can pull 

700 # from the API service. Accommodating for capitalization. 

701 file_type = str(file_type).lower() 

702 valid_api_file_types = ("wcs", "new_fits", "rdls", "axy", "corr") 

703 if file_type not in valid_api_file_types: 

704 raise error.WebRequestError( 

705 "The provided file type to be downloaded is not a valid type which can" 

706 " be downloaded, it must be one of: {fty}".format( 

707 fty=valid_api_file_types 

708 ) 

709 ) 

710 # Construct the URL for the request. It is a little different from the 

711 # normal API scheme so a new method is made. 

712 def _construct_file_download_url(ftype: str, id: str) -> str: 

713 """Construct the file curl from the file type `ftype` and the 

714 job id `id`.""" 

715 url = "http://nova.astrometry.net/{_type}_file/{_id}".format( 

716 _type=ftype, _id=id 

717 ) 

718 return url 

719 

720 file_download_url = _construct_file_download_url(ftype=file_type, id=job_id) 

721 # Before downloading the file, check that the file actually exists. 

722 if job_id is None: 

723 raise error.WebRequestError("There is no job to download the file from.") 

724 if library.http.get_http_status_code(url=file_download_url) != 200: 

725 raise error.WebRequestError( 

726 "The file download link is not giving an acceptable http status code." 

727 " It is likely that the job is still processing and thus the data files" 

728 " are not ready." 

729 ) 

730 # Download the file. 

731 library.http.download_file_from_url( 

732 url=file_download_url, filename=filename, overwrite=True 

733 ) 

734 return None 

« prev     ^ index     » next       coverage.py v6.4.1, created at 2022-06-20 10:53 -1000
